section.section: In addition to the powers set forth elsewhere in this article and subject to the provisions of Title 10 of the State Government Article, on or before October 1, 1987, the Secretary shall adopt regulations for certifying youth camps and for issuing letters of compliance.
An applicant for a certificate shall submit an application to the Department on the form that the Secretary requires.

An application for a certificate or for a letter of compliance shall include:
The name and permanent mailing address of the applicant;
The proposed location of the youth camp; and
Any other information and fee that the Department requires.

For a unit or agency subject to the provisions of this subtitle, the Secretary shall require the unit or agency to complete only one application for certification for all youth camps directed or operated by that unit or agency.
The Department shall be solely responsible for implementing and enforcing the provisions of this subtitle.

Except as provided in subparagraph (iii) of this paragraph, the Secretary may impose a fee for the purpose of inspecting, monitoring, and regulating youth camps in accordance with § 2-104 of this article.
A camp accredited or certified in accordance with the provisions of subsection (b)(9) of this section may not be charged a fee under the provisions of this article.

The operator of a youth camp directed or operated by a bona fide religious organization shall:
Submit an application for certification;
Submit an application for a letter of compliance and have the youth camp inspected by the Department; or
Submit an application for a letter of compliance and proof of an alternative form of accreditation acceptable to the Secretary under subsection (b)(9) of this section.

When a youth camp is operating under subparagraph (i) of this paragraph, and an inspection reveals health or safety violations of the regulations adopted under this subtitle, the Secretary may issue an order to abate the violation or to cease operation.

text.section:
The Secretary may not adopt regulations that set ratios for camper to medical staff personnel except for:
Camp health supervisors at a camp where 50% or more of the campers have identified medical problems;
Personnel required to meet emergency safety standards, for example the number of persons that require certification in cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR) and first aid; and
Camp health supervisors, or their designees, trained to administer medicine to campers.

The Secretary shall cooperate with other departments or agencies to facilitate the activities of the departments or agencies in carrying out responsibilities for enforcing the laws and regulations relating to youth camps.
